website_summaries.verdict: Added skin, fur, and urinary benefits make this hairball supplement perfect for regular use.
pros: Contains essential fatty acids that lead to healthy skin and hair
Includes cranberry powder for urinary health
Noticeable reduction in hairballs after 2-3 days
cons: Requires giving 4 tablets, twice daily for effective hairball reduction

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful - BUT
customer_reviews.text: PLEASE don't tell my 4 cats that these are good for them! To my dismay, all 4 LOVE these and try to crowd each other out for their daily dose (oops, treat!)! After not quite a month, we think we're seeing improvement in their furriness. UPDATE: THESE LAST TWO CONTAINER I RECEIVED ARE SO DRY AND HARD THE CATS ARE HAVING TROUBLE EATING THEM! IT'S AWFUL! I'M AFRAID THEY CHOKE, EVEN AFTER I BREAK THEM INTO SMALLER PIECES!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Kenworthy

customer_reviews.title: Something different than sample
customer_reviews.text: Had a sample of this - little packet of 15 or so chews - and the cat LOVED them. Ordered this as we got low. Cat will not eat them. Licked a couple of times and then walked away. Something is different. These seem harder too. He wouldn't even try them when I broke them apart. UGH! And he's my long-haired cat so I was thrilled to find a hairball treat he would eat - now it's back to the drawing board.
customer_reviews.author: furbabymamaof6

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for a while (good price) but when my most recent order came, the color of the pill was different. My cat started throwing up a lot of hairballs and then I noticed his coat was not as soft as it used to be. I think they changed the product ingredients or they sent out an outdated product. Returned for my money back. I've gone back to Vetri Science, fingers crossed that one works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: He loves them AND they work
customer_reviews.text: Five year old Moose is an avid groomer and daily hairballs were becoming a fact of life. Unfortunately, he also would dry heave several times after purging the hairball. With the twice daily treat of these, Moose is no longer vomiting or dry heaving...but he whines if he doesn’t get his “nummy” on time. I thank the company for their product!!
customer_reviews.author: Sparky955

customer_reviews.title: I wanted so much for this product to be accepted but...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted so much for this product - vet recommended! - to replace the crunchy, salty, low-nutrition grocery-store variety. But the kitties, even with empty food bowls and no kibble all day, either sniffed and tried to bury the halved bits, or tasted and THEN tried to bury the halved bits. Darn! Tried again the next morning, same same...thank you Amazon for the refund w/o need to return...
customer_reviews.author: Linden Hills Girl

customer_reviews.title: It Really Helps
customer_reviews.text: My Cat was having a very hard time with to be blunt... pooping I brought her to the veterinarian and he stated that her stool is very hard and getting stuck in her bowls/track. He gave her some oil stuff that I had to give her daily for two weeks and then I found these online and they work. Her stool is now softer and easier for her to pass, she still has somedays but her hairballs and pooping problems have really improved.
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: Can not beak down to cats satifaction!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased many times now, only problem is that cat will not eat unless I can get it down to almost powder form! And I can NOT!! They always seem to be stale! Every now and then, I run into a kind of soft one in the middle, which means they are probably soft but stale. Mine are never soft! I need to know how to break them down bc I have arthritis in hands and have problems doing that. I throw away a lot bc she will not eat them!
customer_reviews.author: dixiepeach

customer_reviews.title: My cats are picky
customer_reviews.text: My cats are picky. They won't eat the treats unless I break them in half and hand feed them. Then, sometimes, they won't eat them. Still, I'm going to keep trying because one cat barfs way too many times. She grooms herself and our other cat, so lots of hairballs. I like the ingredients and think they will do a good job as long as my cats aren't so darn picky. ( They are picky about everything)
customer_reviews.author: BugBarb

customer_reviews.title: No more hair balls!
customer_reviews.text: My cats go crazy for these treats! Plus they’re unable to conspire to steal, then chew open the container as they do treat bags, since it’s heavy and the lid is secure. Both our cats are long-haired, so they would frequently hack up hair balls that my husband and I would discover with our bare feet. These have been effective in eliminating hair balls, plus their coats look healthier (shinier, fluffier). These are soft chews. They’re a bit big, but I easily break them in half so they can be ingested more easily. They have a strong-ish odor, but it’s non-offensive.
customer_reviews.author: Bassplayer1229

customer_reviews.title: Product Quality Has Declined
customer_reviews.text: My 2 cats Used to really like these Pet Natural Hairball Chews. Lately, the product quality appears to have declined and 1 cat has difficulty in chewing/swallowing these. Before, these chews were a dark brown color and a somewhat soft consistency. The last 2 bottles I purchased have product that is very hard, dry and faded in color - like it's old and been exposed to air. This product did seem to help a little w/ hairball problem but not good if cats don't like it.
customer_reviews.author: Tropical Cats

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves these and so do I
customer_reviews.text: I've only been using them for a few days, but I already notice a difference in the texture my cat's coat. I'm pleased with the ingredients and not bothered by the size. I give her two and she breaks them into smaller pieces so she can eat them without a problem. Keeps her busy for a few minutes. I'm hopeful this will solve more than one problem for my over-groomer.
customer_reviews.author: metis68

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves these!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these! She goes crazy for them like cat treats. Most importantly they work to help control hairball, and help get rid of ones that have already formed. I do use these in combination with a non-petroleum based gel, that I give my cat periodically as well. However, when I give my cat 3-5 of these treats,three times a week, they seem to control hairball well.
customer_reviews.author: Sparkles

customer_reviews.title: Cats will love them.
customer_reviews.text: My two blue Russians love these & their coats are beautiful & shiny & super soft. I've even been able to teach them a few tricks using these because they love them so much. Also, no more hairballs from my younger one that had been having problems.
customer_reviews.author: S. Vigil

customer_reviews.title: ... bought another brand at the store and it worked fantastic so I thought I would try this more natural ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought another brand at the store and it worked fantastic so I thought I would try this more natural one. My cat ate it without a fuss (especially when I cut it up into more bite size pieces) but she was coughing up hairballs even though she NEVER did that with the other product I bought at the store. Maybe it's just my cats digestive system but, it just didn't work for us.
customer_reviews.author: Valley G1rl

customer_reviews.title: I'll be reordering these
customer_reviews.text: One of our kitties (born the runt of the litter) wasn't "regular" and I got this so she could "go" more often. It's been working. And she really likes them. If I give her two she vomits, so I just keep her to one daily and she's become more regular. Her sister, who has longer "downy" fur, doesn't like them at all, and she's likely to need it for hairballs. Go figure.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Emerson

customer_reviews.title: Too hard.  My cat is refusing them.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't seem to be palatable for my guy who has not shown himself to be a picky eater. Difficult to break up but even with smaller pieces not my cat's first choice so cannot judge effectiveness fairly. I missed the return window by 3-days in an attempt to feed these mixed into various wet and dry food combinations.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Cats are addicted to these
customer_reviews.text: After my cats barfed up gross hairballs I decided to give these a try. It's been several months later and no hairballs! My cats love these, they go nuts for them (must be the chicken liver ingredient). They will fight over these chews. The leftover dust crumbs in the jar I poured over their food as a topper (one of them is a picky eater) and she happily gobbled it all up. Even if they see the empty container their kitty eyes will light up like it's Christmas...
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Cat likes it. Carpet does too.
customer_reviews.text: Picky kitty eats these with no delay, and hasn't had a hairball in the 30 days that he's been eating these. All other hairball treats that I've tried required something mixed with them for complete consumption. With no hairball treats he has very regular hairballs (about once a week) as he has ridiculously long hair.
customer_reviews.author: HoneySuckle

customer_reviews.title: Much better and easier than the gels...
customer_reviews.text: I can only give 4 stars because there isn't any definitive way for me to measure or know the impact of these treats, but I do feel that my cats throw up fewer hairballs. I also use the probiotic treat for digestive ease, and I like that one as well. My cats like these treats, and hate the gel version of hairball treatment. They are semi-soft, and they smell malty, not good exactly but not bad at all. I'd recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Liz S.

customer_reviews.title: This hairball medicine really works.
customer_reviews.text: Oscar would like to say that he really loves your hairball treats." I wait each morning by my food mat for those treats." As Oscar's servant, I don't have to fight with him to take the PteNaturals hairball medicine that he needs, since he is a long-haired cat. He hardly ever has a hairball problem anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best treats I have found so far
customer_reviews.text: I'm a cat sitter. I have clients throughout downtown Los Angeles. I know a little bit about cats and I'm always looking for a healthy treat for my two kids. This is it. both of them like it and it has stopped the problem of hairballs. I am very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Alain V Berrebi

customer_reviews.title: The pills are too big to be seen as treats ...
customer_reviews.text: The pills are too big to be seen as treats by the cats. One cat likes 100%, the other likes only 50% of the time, but only when the pill is cut into quarters. I've taken to breaking them up and micking them with their food. The pills seem to work, the number of,hairballs and other vomiting incidents has reduces significantly, maybe once or twice a month as opposed to twice weekly.
customer_reviews.author: James R Purdon

customer_reviews.title: Helps with the hairballs
customer_reviews.text: Actually relieved to have found something that helps with the cat's hairball problems. Wife's cat went from throwing hairballs several times a week, to now just once or twice a month. So I like this product and I will continue to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Since we started feeding them these treats, they have not had any hairball problems
customer_reviews.text: So far the cats love these treats, which is good because they refused to eat the paste we had used with our previous cat. Since we started feeding them these treats, they have not had any hairball problems. Keeping our fingers crossed!
customer_reviews.author: valeen

customer_reviews.title: Our Cats Love Them
customer_reviews.text: After years of using hairball prevention from a tube, I finally found a great one in chewable form. I do have to tear them into smaller pieces, but that's no big deal. The cats love the flavor and it's a lot easier than trying to get them to use the paste stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Jade Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves them and they work
customer_reviews.text: My cat LOVES these! Aside from her loving them, I feel they have really helped her get fewer hairballs and vomit less. I was giving her Vet Best hairball remedy which she also liked but it didn't seem to help with the hairball issue so they ended up just being a treat. These do!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Cats won’t eat
customer_reviews.text: Both my cats ate one and refuse to eat more. They are not picky eaters and run when there’s food in their dish, but they see this hit their dish and they walk the other way! I bought a whole container that I don’t know what to do with now. Money wasted.....
customer_reviews.author: Kizia Mizia

customer_reviews.title: All 3 cats walked away and do not recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Product looked and smelled fake, not like something that would attract a cat to eat it. All three of my cats did not eat this and none of them are picky eaters. My dogs, however, gobbled them up so they are not going to waste.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy J.

customer_reviews.title: Not for my kitty
customer_reviews.text: Not sure these helped my cat. They are not grain free. Unfortunately she itched and itched after eating these.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Tolliver

customer_reviews.title: Cats refused to eat them
customer_reviews.text: What does thickness and sheerness mean??? NONE of the cats would eat them so that tells me something. As for working, how can one know when the cats won't eat them. Not happy I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Fayte

customer_reviews.title: Best cat treats ever
customer_reviews.text: We have given these Pet Naturals of Vermont treats to three generations of cats, and all have enjoyed their taste while we believe they have also benefited from their healthy formula. Our vet approves of them too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Might be great, I'll never know
customer_reviews.text: Neither did my cats would eat these. Not even after hiding it in their wet food. Only resulted in wasted wet food. I'm just disappointed. No fault to seller. My finicky felines.
customer_reviews.author: Darlita

customer_reviews.title: Such a good deal compared to the smaller sized bags
customer_reviews.text: Such a good deal compared to the smaller sized bags.... I'm not sure about the furball removal part of things since my cat don't really have an issue with that but with the omega content in this I can see a definite positive change in quality of my cat's fur after giving him this. And cat will go crazy and do anything to get this so I'm guessing it's a good healthy beneficial treat after all
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Less shedding
customer_reviews.text: Cat is shedding lot less. He likes the taste. Have to break up as too big.
customer_reviews.author: Shanandoah Gasco

customer_reviews.title: Safe and it works.
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat with long fur that I give 2of these a day to help her cough up her furballs. It works. Before When I gave her petromalt or any petroleum based lubricant she couldn't tolerate it and ended up at theVet 's for vomiting that wouldn't end.She has a large amount of fur.
customer_reviews.author: Mom to 12

customer_reviews.title: Seems to Help
customer_reviews.text: My cats eat these but not greedily like the commercial treats. They look to be better for them nutritionally and I'm cleaning up less hairballs, so must be helping.
customer_reviews.author: mb

customer_reviews.title: Allergic Reaction
customer_reviews.text: Both my cats vomited up their food, after they had just 1 of these chews. I waited a couple of days, simply to see if they would do better the next time... both again vomited up their food, so I need to return the bottle of chews.
customer_reviews.author: SharriLouise

customer_reviews.title: Cats won’t eat them
customer_reviews.text: None of my four cats will touch these. They smell like iron pills to me. Need to work on the smell because my cats won’t touch them.
customer_reviews.author: jaime ladner

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: My oliver is picky..picky..picky...but he loves these...i give them to him as treats....he doesnt mind....i have to break them up but he gobbles them up
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Such shiny and soft fur!
customer_reviews.text: Solar (cream Siamese) has hard time chewing a whole piece, so breaking it in half helps her devour it. Stone (American Short) sprints to me whenever I shake the bottle, and breaking in half helps him eat slowly. Whenever Stone struggles with hair balls, I give him more as instructed. Both cats seem to shed much less after I changed hair ball treats to this!
customer_reviews.author: Melody Song

customer_reviews.title: Cats Like Them
customer_reviews.text: This is easier than the paste. I can't fully verify how well it works but it's easy to incorporate this into their everyday diet because both of my cats will eat it willingly.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: They stink horribly
customer_reviews.text: Even my cat that eats everything refuses to eat these chews. And frankly they STINK. Most likely they are rancid.
customer_reviews.author: Stormfrost "Bev"

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: One cat won't touch them and the other throws up after eating them. Disappointing outcomes since typically use other products of this brand
customer_reviews.author: buyer

customer_reviews.title: My cats like it!!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loved these treats and asked for a second one, which is pretty exciting as she is pretty picky. My long hair one also seemed to like it. They used to like the the greenies hairball treats but that passion petered out, so I’m so happy to have another option!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Takes a long time for our cats to tolerate this ...
customer_reviews.text: Takes a long time for our cats to tolerate this. Oversized "caplets". Once exposed to the air they smell and get soft which wierds the cats out. I think they are on to something but it needs refinement. Going w/for now.
customer_reviews.author: radio54

customer_reviews.title: They seem to have helped reduce the incidents of coughing up disgusting hairballs, which makes both my cat and me ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product as treats for my long haired, hairball prone 15# cat, purchasing them in small bags at Petco. They seem to have helped reduce the incidents of coughing up disgusting hairballs, which makes both my cat and me much happier. I'm delighted that they are available in a jar in quantity at a much reduced price per treat.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: my cats love
customer_reviews.text: Iam satisfied with this order and its helped keep my cats hairballs away an I bought a small pack but does not last long with three cats so got this bigger pack
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: These really work.
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these, and she's sort of picky. Hey for is soft and silly. Much less throwing up. Way fewer hairballs.
customer_reviews.author: inasuek

customer_reviews.title: Decrease in fur balls
customer_reviews.text: My cat sometimes eats these right away and sometimes they sit in her dish for days. However since I bought it in May, she has only had one fur ball episode so that’s much improved!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea B. Hartman

customer_reviews.title: My cat likes it!
customer_reviews.text: I feed one a day to my cat. He loves it so no complaints and I will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: ParkLife

customer_reviews.title: just mean furballs who like NOTHING.
customer_reviews.text: They don't eat these well at all. Generally I am picking them up and tossing them into the trash. Not the products fault probably, just mean furballs who like NOTHING.
customer_reviews.author: Phae

customer_reviews.title: Our cats love it
customer_reviews.text: It seems the same that the 30 Bite Size Chews. Only the shape change.
customer_reviews.author: LauraV

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I have been giving these to my cat (1 per day) for several years. He loves to chase and capture them before eating. He has no hairball problems at all now and his stools are not as hard as is typical for cats who only eat dry food. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: cat m

customer_reviews.title: Our Cat Loves Them!
customer_reviews.text: Pet Naturals of Vermont has Great Products, Our Cat Loves The Hairball and Calming Treats, They Really Work!!!
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: For babies love it!
customer_reviews.text: Flavor and smell good. Everytime I say treats! They come running because they low this vitamins.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy Ritchie

customer_reviews.title: My cats don't like these
customer_reviews.text: Have to hide them in other treats or my cats won't eat them
customer_reviews.author: H May

customer_reviews.title: my cat likes this
customer_reviews.text: no dislikes, this is so much easier to use than the hairball gels
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: My kitty loves these!
customer_reviews.text: My little kitty started suffering with the coughing up of hair balls and after giving her these, which she loves, she no longer coughs or hacks.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Liked them at first but now won't eat them
customer_reviews.text: My cat devoured them at first but after about two weeks will no longer eat them. I followed the directions on the bottle. Hard to tell if they work or not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves the taste thinks there treats :}
customer_reviews.text: Helped my cats hairball huffing within the 1st week, its improved. Cat loves the taste thinks there treats :}
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Smells terrible
customer_reviews.text: Smells terrible. My cat won't eat it. So i broke it down into his morning wet food and he eats around the pieces. They are big tablets. He gets hairballs randomly so i can t say if its effector not yet. He is fed iams hairball care dry food and i use some hairball control shampoo when he gets a bath on top of brushing his coat.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Levin

customer_reviews.title: This stuff really works!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love these and they have really reduced my cat from vomiting. I have 1 male cat and he’s been throwing up his food very often but now i give my cats these treats twice daily and it seemed to resolve the issue. However i still see occasional hair balls but i expect that. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Nicky W.

customer_reviews.title: Cat likes these.
customer_reviews.text: I have been giving my cat one of these every night for a couple years. I break it up for her. She comes and taps me on the arm if I'm not there with this treat at bedtime and leads me to the bed. She loves them and her fur is soft and glossy. It seems to cut down on the hairball incidents.
customer_reviews.author: Pleinairpainter

customer_reviews.title: Not appealing
customer_reviews.text: 2 of my 3 cats refuse to touch these. Won’t be buying them again.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Nanny

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves them!
customer_reviews.text: I use these as a treat when he gets his medicine, twice a day. Since I've been giving him the chews, when he hears the medicine alarm clock he comes running because he loves these so much. They are large and he is happy with only 1/2 a treat each time. His coat really looks beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: G Brickman

customer_reviews.title: Fur balls
customer_reviews.text: Given daily to my 3 cats, and brushing weekly with the Furminator, this has helped a lot! Fabulous product!
customer_reviews.author: DesertRat

customer_reviews.title: Cats don't like them
customer_reviews.text: Once again, I have 3 cats and not one of them will eat them.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Pettit

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My cats love these. And they do seem to work!
customer_reviews.author: SaviM

customer_reviews.title: Not so great....
customer_reviews.text: These treats are hard and our cat won’t eat them unless I break them up and put them on her food.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and great flavor
customer_reviews.text: I give these to my cat everyday. These are so much easier to use then the liquid your suppose to put on their paws.
customer_reviews.author: Janessa

customer_reviews.title: My two cats hate the smell
customer_reviews.text: My two cats hate the smell. I will mix this with their treats and they will eat around these and finish the treats!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: No More Hairball Hack!
customer_reviews.text: I usually purchase this product in smaller zip lock resealable packets. Glad to see P.N. of V. is finally selling a larger quantity in a good screw top container. My cat really likes these treats, and I think they have helped with her hairball issues.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Cat's love these.
customer_reviews.text: My cat's love them, and my girl hasn't had problems with the hairballs since I started her on them.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Bearss

customer_reviews.title: They work... trust this brand.
customer_reviews.text: As hairball control, they work. It helps when you trust the brand.
customer_reviews.author: CecBric

customer_reviews.title: Not cat approved
customer_reviews.text: Ate every days for about a week then refused completely. Cats gagging and heaving.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Preventive usage
customer_reviews.text: I am worry about my cats kidneys so I give them 1 capsule 3 days a week. They don't have any major hairball issues but they do swallow a lot of hair so this is mainly for prevention for me.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: This is the best harball medicine.
customer_reviews.text: Two a day keeps the hairballs away. If your cat has a problem then you give them four, then cut down to two a day.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: My cat did not like these. Even when I tried hiding them under the food or cutting them into smaller pieces and hiding it in the food, my cat would not eat them.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: CAT OWNER DREAM - NO MORE HAIRBALLS ON THE CARPET
customer_reviews.text: Use this all the time for my long hair cat and they work, and I LOVE the larger container. They do tend to dry out BUT the cat still loves them!
customer_reviews.author: WiseConsumer

customer_reviews.title: My cat always wants more!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these!! I haven't noticed a huge change in the amount of hairballs but I will keep using these and hope it slowly keeps improving.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Cooley

customer_reviews.title: Yammy for my cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves to eat it. I give him one per day, and he starts not to choke and his hair become smooth. What's more, the price is good.
customer_reviews.author: wry15172378012

customer_reviews.title: 1 cat loves them, other 2 won't touch
customer_reviews.text: Out of 3 cats, only 1 that doesn't get hairballs will eat them. The flavor ingredient is artificial, which is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Batgirl

customer_reviews.title: Reformulated??
customer_reviews.text: These seem different than my last order. They have a terrible order and don't do anything to combat the hairballs. He's still throwing them up!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lragone78

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: I have really liked this product but used to get it at stores. Now I can get more for a better price and it's the same product.
customer_reviews.author: mya

customer_reviews.title: working for my cat
customer_reviews.text: one of my cats needed these badly. Since day one, no incidents with hairballs. he even asks for his (chewable) tablet every morning and evening.
customer_reviews.author: mainebaby

customer_reviews.title: Love this item!
customer_reviews.text: I liked and chose this item for its reviews! My cats love them and there were so many tablets for the price! They really do work.
customer_reviews.author: Cortney freeman

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: My cat hated these, wouldn’t even eat them. They went into the trash can
customer_reviews.author: Christina Arnesen

customer_reviews.title: Not good for my cats.
customer_reviews.text: Cats gobbled it down but we have had an increase of vomiting in both our mature cats...could be the ingredients because we have switched to more nstural cat food and the only comman factor for frequent vomiting was this formula.
customer_reviews.author: liz Broberg

customer_reviews.title: Helpful to households with multiple cats
customer_reviews.text: This size is very beneficial to pet owners who have more than one cat that experiences hairballs. I'm glad the size is available.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: They love them and I give them 1 a day when ...
customer_reviews.text: My cats and puppy go bonkers for these! They love them and I give them 1 a day when I remember. It's their special treat and their fur is so shiny!
customer_reviews.author: B. West

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves these vitamins
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these vitamins. I'm buying a second helping!
customer_reviews.author: June

customer_reviews.title: Pet Naturals of Vermont Hairball is my "go-to" hairball product ...
customer_reviews.text: Pet Naturals of Vermont Hairball is my "go-to" hairball product for my long-haired cat. I've given her two tablets daily for the past five years. She meows to remind me each evening when it's time for her special hairball "treat."
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Nash

customer_reviews.title: My cat highly rated these treats
customer_reviews.text: My cats loves these treats. I give it to him every morning and he’s purring before I can get them out of the bottle.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Product smells burnt. Cats wouldn't eat it. Thought maybe it was a fluke but the 2nd shipment was the same. Don't waste your money.

product_meta.title: Pet Naturals of Vermont - Hairball, Daily Digestive, Skin and Coat Support for Cats, 160 Bite-Sized Chews
product_meta.description: Hairball is a natural, easy to use digestive supplement that supports less shedding and a healthy coat on the outside and, proper GI function on the inside. We have included Psyllium fiber for digestive health as well as Omega fatty acids to keep the skin hydrated and the coat healthy. Great for long haired cat breeds, hairball helps manage excessive shedding that can end up as uncomfortable hairball issues for your cat. Each bottle includes 160 easy to administer chicken liver flavored chews. Our chews are free of corn, wheat and artificial ingredients. Pet Natural's of Vermont products are NASC approved and come with a 100% satisfaction guarantee.
feature_bullets: Hairball does not act like a laxative or lubricant and provides a more natural approach to managing feline digestive health.
Hairball for cats is a natural supplement that contains no Mineral oils or herbs.
Hairball includes cranberry to support urinary tract health.
Each jar includes 160 easy to administer chicken liver flavored chews. Our chews are free of corn, wheat and artificial ingredients.
All pet Natural’s of Vermont products are manufactured in the USA and distributed from our offices in the Green Mountains of Vermont.
